Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Rotten fish bought out of states seized.description: ALAPPUZHA: In the wake of trawling ban, people are facing acute shortage of fish. Exploiting this situation, many fish vendors are selling rotten fish creating serious health risks to their customers. Smelling its danger, the health squad of Cherthala municipality has come into action seizing large quantities of damaged fish from Cherthala’s famous fish market. The squad of the municipality on Thursday morning conducted raids in its fish marker as they received numerous complaints saying due to trawling ban large quantities of out of state highly damaged fish were being sold from the market. Acting upon such complaints, the health squad have found that complaints were genuine. "We seized over 300kg of damaged fish belonging to ‘Kera’ category during the first raid today morning in a short span of time from the market. While we were inspecting the fish, we found majority of such fish’ eyes and head portions were in decomposed state. Each fish we seized had around 25kg weight. We seized rotten fish from the fish vendors Prasad, Abhilash, Nazar and Joy. Each of them was fined of Rs 10,000. When we inquired about the fish, they told that those fish were many months old and it even came for selling after many weeks since it caught from the sea. Even before boats reached in the harbor, these fish already reached in rotten state. Then they merchants placed these fish in freezers. In order to cheat their customers, they are selling fish after cutting it into pieces. While we were conducting the checking, we found the fish vendors placed these fish on the dirty floor under tarpaulin. We also traced the damaged fish which were kept inside of freezers," said the health squad leader C S Baburaj. When the checking was going on, fish vendor Nazr tried to escape from the market with two damaged fish in his cycle. However, the health squad chased him in their jeep and held him. Though fish vendors united and tried to prevent the checking of health squad, the squad members did not go back and they checked all the fish in the market. All the seized damaged fish were destroyed by the health squads. Municipal health supervisor C S Baburaj led the squad. Health inspectors M R Sreekumar, R Shibu, junior health inspectors P N Deepthi, O Salin, S Ajith and Simon were the other members off the squad. The municipal secretary V M Lalachan requested the people to desist away from the buying of damaged fish. ‘’ We would continue their raids in coming days and people can approach the health squad to register their complaints against the sale of rotten fish,’’ Lalachan said. Boat with 243 sails into oblivion, probe.description: LUCKNOW: Uttar Pradesh Governor Ram Naik and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath led the International Yoga Day event along with ministers, officials and others at the Raj Bhawan, here on Friday. Adityanath said, "We are carrying forward the tradition set up seers and saints for whom Yoga was a part of life. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had taken Yoga to a global platform and I express my gratitude to him for this. Yoga is the best way to keep illness at bay." He later performed yoga at Raj Bhawan along with other participants. In Lucknow alone, yoga camps were organised at 11 places, under the guidance of yoga trainers. In Saharanpur, Army jawans performed yoga on horseback which became a major attraction. All ministers and legislators led yoga camps in their respective constituencies on Friday. Kochi schools to observe reading week.description: KOCHI: With the state celebrating Vaayanadinam (Reading Day) on June 19 to commemorate the birth anniversary of P N Panicker, pioneer of Kerala’s library movement, the city schools are organising a reading week with a slew of programmes aimed at promoting reading habit among students. Several activities that will inspire free thinking and personality development will be organized as part of the programme. Book review sessions by students, reading hours and interactions with writers who will deliver lectures on the importance of reading are planned. The Kendriya Vidyalaya at INS Dronacharya will organize a 45-minute mass reading programme in which the all students, teachers, non-teaching faculty and principal will read newspapers or books. “We will also have quiz, Reading Day pledge and book reviews. A speech about P N Panciker will also be delivered by a faculty to make students familiar with his contributions to the society,” said Moly T N, school librarian. At Toc H Public School, a ‘nataka-kavita parisheelanakalari’ will be held by professionals to train students in drama and poetry. “Apart from book reviews and newspaper reading, there will be a role-playing session in which students will enact characters of classical works. We also plan a literary quiz,” said Librarian Asha Sankar. St. Antony’s Public School Kizhakkambalam is planning a week-long celebration. “Our school is located in a rural area and we want our students to be introduced to the world of reading and books,” said school principal Liju P Alex. At Girinagar Bhavan’s Vidya Mandir, a students’ radio will be launched on Wednesday, which will broadcast programmes by students during lunchtime. “We will also give a platform for the budding writers among our students to showcase their talent,” said school principal Girija T S. Students will have to write articles on current issues and present it at Vidyodaya School. Principal Esther Agnes said that the school would dedicate a 45-minute period exclusively for reading every month. “We have asked students to find out quotations by personalities that could motivate them,” she said. The Guardian Angel school plans initiatives by its literary club members to popularise e-reading by familiarising students with various reading devices like Kindle and apps like Rivet and Airtel books, said Fr Nixon, school principal. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Publicize government schemes for citizen.description: KOCHI: State government’s schemes that can aid citizens in distress should be given publicity so that they are not forced to reveal their distress to the public and seek their help or approach courts with litigations, says the Kerala High Court. Citizens in distress being pushed to helplessness and forced to seek indulgence of fellow citizens, with pictures of family members crying in deep despair, is an affront to the dignity of the citizenry as a whole. Therefore, the government must rise to the occasion and offer all support, justice Devan Ramachandran said in an order. Highlighting the need for giving publicity to schemes that can be availed by citizens in distress, the court said in an order, “The information regarding these avenues are generally not available to the citizens at large and I am certain that many of them are, therefore, constrained to go public with their distress to seek the beneficence of fellow citizens and other non-governmental agencies. If the State has such mechanisms, under which citizens can obtain immediate reliefs in such situations, I am certain that this information should be made available to the public at large, including the mode and manner in which they can apply for it, so that litigations of this nature would become unnecessary.” The court considered a petition (WP-C No. 39223/2019) filed by 56-year-old Alavi Kunhalan of Kavarakundu in Malappuram. He had availed a loan of Rs16 lakhs from Malappuram District Cooperative Bank Ltd and defaulted in repayment due to extreme financial crisis. One of his two daughters is mentally challenged whereas the other one is suffering from a serious heart condition. Approaching the high court, he had sought to put coercive action by the bank on hold and to allow him to repay the loan in instalments. Following the court’s directive, the court asked the government to inform what aid can be provided to the petitioner. Revenue department submitted that while the government cannot interfere in the SARFAESI proceedings initiated by the bank, aid can be provided under Chief Minister’s Distress Relief Scheme. Disability pension can be availed for the petitioner’s daughter. There is no scheme to aid those who fail to repay loans, the court was told. State attorney KV Sohan submitted to the court that apart from these measures, the petitioner can seek assistance from Chief Minister’s Debt Relief Fund, Social Security Pension System, and Minority Development Corporation. As the petitioner’s counsel R Ranjith Manjeri submitted that his client wants to seek assistance under these schemes, the court postponed the case for two weeks. Overseas investment for Kerala's develop.description: KOCHI: A petition filed before the Kerala high court questioning the constitutional validity of Masala Bonds to secure investment from overseas has been withdrawn by the petitioner. The petition (WP-C No. 16711/2019) was filed by Ranjit Karthikeyan of Vanchiyoor in Thiruvananthapuram, who is a chartered accountant, by alleging that the steps taken for issuing the bonds under Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Act of 1999 violates Article 293(1), which stipulates that state governments are allowed to borrow only within the country. A counsel representing the petitioner sought to withdraw the petition after a division bench comprising chief justice Hrishikesh Roy and justice AK Jayasankaran Nambiar pointed out that the investment is being canvassed not by the state government but by Kerala Infrastructure Investment Board (KIIB). The petitioner has no case that security offered is against the consolidated fund of the state, the court said. While withdrawing the plea, the counsel also sought permission to file a fresh one, if so advised, after collecting necessary information. While dismissing the case as not pressed, the court has reserved the liberty of the petitioner to approach the court again. It was contended by the petitioner that KIIB is a statutory body and a ‘State’ and is therefore bound by Article 293(1). A plain reading of the article makes it clear that KIIB violated it by issuing rupee-denominated bonds to overseas investors. Executive power of the state extends to borrowings only within India and borrowing from overseas investors, even in rupee-denominated bonds, has not been envisaged or provided for by the Constitution, the petition had stated. Issuing of Masala Bonds to overseas investors is illegal, arbitrary, and unreasonable and violates Article 14 (equality before law), 19 (right to freedom), and 21 (right to life and liberty) of the Constitution, the petitioner had argued while stating that any act of the government must be reasonable and should be towards public interest. The high rate of interest of 9.723% puts a burden on the public exchequer, thus compromising public interest, it was alleged. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Thaikkudam Bridge to perform in Summerfe.description: KOCHI: Artists of Thaikkudam Bridge are set to be the first Indian band to perform in the 51st edition of Summerfest, considered the biggest music festival in the world. The festival has several celebrity participants including Lionel Richie, Jennifer Lopez, Megadeth and Papa Roach. The festival authenticated by the Guinness book of world records, is happening at Henry Maier festival park, Milwaukee, Wisconsin in the United States. The band will be performing at 18 venues (New York, San Francisco, Chicago, Seattle, Arizona, Dallas and Houston. The gig coordinated by Evan Murray would be held in two schedules from June 26 to June 30 and July 2 to July 7. The 11-day festival, expected to see a footfall of 9,00,000 music lovers, will feature 800 bands who would perform across 11 stages. This is for the second time that Thaikkudam Bridge is touring the US. The band has performed over 90 concerts outside India and over 400 shows inside. Extraordinary gazette now online.description: KOCHI: For long, anyone who wanted to access the extraordinary gazette, which could be published on any day of the week by the printing and stationary department, as per the demand of various government departments, there was no other option than to visit the libraries of handful of institutions which subscribed and stored them. The situation has changed as the extraordinary gazette notifications are now available online. Advocates and government officials who needed a copy of the notifications had to make a trip to the high court, office of the advocate general, assembly secretariat or the state central library. A copy of the gazette would also be with the government departments which publish them. That was it. While the state’s ordinary gazette, a public journal and an authorized legal document published every week by the department of printing and stationary, is available online from 2007 onwards, the publishing of extraordinary gazette to online space marks a significant shift in government approach. Officials and judiciary depend a lot on extraordinary gazette notifications and now they will have them at their fingertips as certified digital documents with legal validity. Jacob George, a faculty with National University of Advanced Legal Studies who had campaigned for such a facility, said this would be of immense use to legal fraternity. “It was hard to find extraordinary gazette notifications all at one place. While there are some teething issues this would be beneficial as it would increase the transparency,” he said. Printing department director Muraleedharan said government departments would be able to directly upload templates of the required notification, which would be published online with digital signatures. “Page length of extraordinary gazette may vary from one to many. It used to be printed as required,” he said. They would be published exclusively online henceforth. Sources in the department said the ordinary gazette currently available at egazette.kerala.gov.in does not have legal validity. The ordinary gazette would also shift to a similar mode when all digital publishing modules are launched in another two months. While the extraordinary gazette has no bearing on general public, once the ordinary gazette notifications became available online as certified documents, public would benefit from it. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Vagamon gets a Rs 99lakh worth facelift.description: Idukki: In a bid to attract more tourists to Vagamon, the tourism department has completed infrastructure works estimated at Rs 99 lakh in the hill station. The works gave a facelift to the destination, said Idukki District Tourism Promotion Council secretary (DTPC) Jayan P Vijayan. The works covered entrance gate, tourism information centre, ticket counter, lifted stone-laid walkway with flowering plants on either side, benches, toilets, rest rooms, censors, LED lightings and waste bins. “The construction works were entrusted with central government agency Vapcos. A garden close to the lake and a children park will be constructed in Vagamon in the second phase of the tourism project,” Jayan said. “The new facilities will be inaugurated during the monsoon tourist season. As many as five lakh tourists visited Vagamon in last year. Nearly 1.5 lakh tourists reached Vagamon during the monsoon last year. The heavy tourist inflow shows Vagamon have a vast tourism potential,” Vijayan said. Para gliding, pine plantation, evergreen meadows are the main attractions in Vagamon. It is a favourite to the tourists for its vast view of the hills from the open space and chilly weather in any season. Vagamon is considered as the third main tourism destination in Idukki. “We hope the new infrastructure works will attract more tourists to the destination. The wide parking area form part of the new infrastructure will be the additional attraction in the destination,” Jayan said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kerala cop Soumya murder: Accused Ajas d.description: ALAPPUZHA: Civil police officer (CPO) NA Ajas, 33, who brutally murdered woman CPO Soumya Pushpakaran and was undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital, succumbed to his burn injuries on Wednesday evening. “His death was confirmed at 5.45pm. His pulse rate was low from Tuesday and his burn injuries affected the functioning of kidneys. He had more than 40% burn injuries and had infection and pneumonia. Doctors told us that cardiac arrest was the reason for his demise. The autopsy will be conducted at the MCH on Thursday,” said Vallikunnam sub-inspector Shaiju Ebrahim. District police chief K M Tomy said that though Ajas has died, they will continue the investigation and once it is over, they will place the investigation report before Kayamkulam judicial first-class magistrate court. Alappuzha judicial first-class magistrate had recorded the statements of Ajas on Sunday. According to the investigation team, Ajas, a native of Kakkanad in Ernakulam, said that he killed Soumya as she refused to marry him and kept distance from him. The relatives of Soumya informed that her funeral will be held by Thursday after her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, arrived here. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Kochi: Woman held for gold smuggling.description: KOCHI: The Customs air intelligence unit on Tuesday recorded the arrest of Alappuzha native Sreelakshmi Jayanti (27), a carrier for a gold smuggling racket, who reportedly dumped 2.5kg of gold in a women’s lavatory at the Cochin international airport after getting nervous during a smuggling bid about three months ago. She was later let off on conditional bail after she promised to cooperate with the probe. “She told us that she brought the gold on her person from Dubai. After dumping the gold in the lavatory next to the arrival gate, she went to Alappuzha and then returned to Dubai. She came back following a demand from the department. Now, we are trying to track down other links in the racket,” said customs commissioner Sumit Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Thiruvananthapuram: Stalker tries to mur.description: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Even as people of the state are yet to recover from the shock of the incident where a policewoman was waylaid and burned alive by her stalker, a similar attempt was made on another woman in Kollam on Monday. Fortunately, the woman escaped unhurt. Eravipuram police have arrested the accused, Shinu (25), a resident of Varkala. He is a welder. The complainant just completed BSc from a college at Chathannoor. According to Eravipuram station house officer C Devarajan, the incident related to the case happened around 5.30pm on Monday. Shinu barged into the woman’s house and tried to pour kerosene over her. However, the woman managed to push him away and run out of the house. The neighbours, who rushed hearing the commotion, overpowered the accused and handed him over to the police. “The accused had approached the woman’s family six months ago with a marriage proposal. Though they were intrested initially, they rejected the proposal after checking their match with an astrologer. Ever since, he had been stalking the woman. She has completed her graduation and had been at home for the past few days. Learning about this, he came looking for her at her house,” the inspector said adding that the accused entered her house by removing the tiles of the roof. His arrest was recorded on Monday night. He was produced before the court and remanded in judicial custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kevin P Joseph murder case: Call records.description: KOTTAYAM: Defence lawyers questioned the authenticity of the telephonic conversations presented by the prosecution in the ongoing trial in the Kevin P Joseph murder case at the principal session court here on Wednesday. The lawyers tried to establish that reports from forensic labs were contradictory. But investigating officer denied the allegations. Kevin Joseph: Married on Friday, murdered on SundayThe defence lawyers also argued that the records of phone conversation between first accused Shyanu Chacko and ASI Biju were doctored. The prosecution has been alleging that Shyanu spoke about murdering Kevin during the calls. But all the phone calls between them were not examined, they said, adding that the prosecution has stated that Shyanu chatted with someone whose contact name was saved as ‘Pappa Kuwait’. That person’s phone has not been examined, the defence lawyers argued. Kevin P Joseph was alive as he ‘fell’ into riverThe defence lawyers also questioned the authenticity of the CCTV visuals. The forensic lab officials initially said that they cannot examine the footage by separating each visual. Later, they said they can do it. The prosecution has submitted the CCTV visuals as proof of the presence of the accused persons in Mannanam. Forensic lab submitted the new report in the court only after the trial started, they said. The defence lawyers have been arguing that the prosecution could not prove beyond suspicion that Kevin was murdered. An accused can’t be punished based on assumptions, they said. However, the investigating officer told the court that the evidence submitted before court were correct and clear. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharajas College students set up a read.description: The students of Maharajas College in Kochi launched a reading corner in Government General Hospital near their campus, to benefit the bystanders of patients. The event, which was held at 10 am today, had the students lining up many magazines, books, newspapers and features for the people in the hospital. They will also be ensuring the maintenance of the reading materials and also regularly filling up the stands with interesting books from time to time, the organisers say. The initiative was as part of Reading Day, which fell on June 19. In Video:Government General Hospital's Reading CornerDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delay in getting NOC hits AMRUT smart ci.description: Palakkad: Palakkad municipality, the only BJP-ruled municipality in the state, has sought the intervention of Union minister for road transport and national highway Nitin Jairam Gadkari as many of the central-assisted Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) smart city projects are held up due to the ‘inordinate and deliberate’ delay in getting no-objection certificate (NOC) from the regional office of the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI). Municipal chairperson Pramila Sasidharan in her letter to the Union minister on June 20, 2019, requested his intervention to complete the development activities within the Mission period. Many of our projects are passing through the roads under public works department (PWD) national highway (NH) division. “Palakkad municipality is carrying out various infrastructure development activities under AMRUT Mission. Though we have submitted our applications for NOC from PWD (NH) for water supply, foot overbridge and storm water drain project, we have not yet received the NOC,” the letter stated. Major projects withheld are storm water drainage from Olavakode to Co-operative College; Storm water drainage of Sultanpetta-Kalmandapam-NH Road; drain desilting and rejuvenation; overbridge at Moyan Girls Higher Secondary School; elevated footpath from PMG Higher Secondary School to Government Victoria College; pedestrian network from Government Victoria College to Anjuvilakk (Sulthanpetta) and Melamuri-Kalmandapam footpath. Vice-chairman of Palakkad municipality C Krishnakumar said that “the municipality was waiting for the past six months to get NOC from the NH authorities for using the highway footpath for various AMRUT projects. “But when we ask the NH regional authorities in Palakkad they will say that the file was sent to their Malappuram office, then it will go to Kozhikode office and finally to Thiruvananthapuram office. There seems to some deliberate delay in giving the NOC. Even the major works of replacing the drinking water pipeline from Malampuzha to Moothanthara overhead water supply tank was held for the past six months,” he said. Though TOI tried to get the reactions of NHAI officials here, nobody picked up their phones. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

2 held for ATM fraud in Kochi.description: KOCHI: In a case of suspected ATM fraud, two persons were taken into custody by Mattancherry police after a guard saw them sticking a piece of paper around a CCTV camera. The accused, who tried to flee after the guard raised an alarm, were caught by local residents. The incident happened at a SBI ATM kiosk at Kalvathy, Mattancherry. Cops are interrogating the accused for more details. The accused told the police that they used to withdraw money from ATMs and keep one currency note back at the slot from where the currency is dispensed after which the machine gets jammed. The accused then used to lodge a complaint at the helpline number about the machine being jammed and hence would get a refund of the whole amount withdrawn. Police said that similar frauds have been reported in the past after which some ATMs were modified. They are probing if the method has again become possible. "As of now, our information is based on the statement of the accused. More details on how they executed the fraud and how many times they have done it in the past can only be known after a probe," said a senior police officer with Mattacherry police. Cops are yet to reveal the names of the accused as their arrests have not been recorded yet. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Driver held for molestation attempt in K.description: MALAPPURAM: A bus driver has been taken into custody by Thenhippalam police for allegedly attempting to molest a woman passenger inside the moving bus, owned by Kallada Travels, on Thursday morning. Police have also impounded the bus which was on its way from Kannur to Kollam. According to Thenhipalam police, the incident occurred when the bus reached at Kakkanchery near Ramanattukara. The accused, second driver of the bus, attempted to molest the woman following which other passengers asked the driver to stop the bus at Thenhippalam police station near Kakkanchery. Police have taken the accused, who is a native of Puthupalli in Kottayam, into custody. Thenhippalam police said that the arrest would be recorded only after collecting detailed statement of the complainant, who is native of Trichi in Tamil Nadu. The bus was travelling from Kannur to Kollam. The contract carriage operator Kallada, is owned by Kallada Suresh. There was public outrage over a group of people associated with the Kallada firm brutally attacking three Bengaluru-bound passengers, in front of its branch office at Vyttila, recently. The issue came to light after a video of the alleged assault of passengers by its staff went viral in the social media. Police had ordered the seizure of two-multi-axle buses owned by the bus firm after the public outrage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Withdraw cash from an ATM, slip in a not.description: KOCHI: It is a neat trick. To make a quick buck, withdraw money from an ATM using a valid debit card, then slip back a currency note into the machine and then claim refund for the entire amount from the bank. The bank would credit the money into the account, thereby almost doubling the cash in hand. Such a fraud came to light on Wednesday with the arrest of Amin Khan (42) from Alwar in Rajasthan and Riyaju Khan (27) from Palwal in Haryana, following high drama at Mattancherry. They had withdrawn Rs 10,000 from their accounts when they were caught red-handed by officials from SBI, located right next to the ATM kiosk at Kalvathy in Mattancherry, for trying to cover CCTV camera with a piece of paper at 8.53am. They fled on seeing security guards, only to be chased down by residents and guards, who overpowered and handed them over to Mattancherry police. During interrogation, they revealed their modus operandi. “For instance, if they withdraw Rs 10,000 and five Rs2000 notes are dispensed, they would slip back one currency note back in. They said that some ATMs would ‘think’ that the entire amount was being taken back,” said Mattancherry CI VS Navas. The accused would call up the bank’s helpline and complain about the debit. As a result, the entire sum would be ‘refunded’ in their account. Navas said the duo managed 13 such frauds in Thiruvananthapuram, Kochi and Tamil Nadu since June 10. The details are being compiled, said police. Sources said that though the attempt at Kalvathy failed, the accused claim they had executed one such fraud in city. Police said that a bank official had informed that this method was not possible. “The bank official told us that there is a way to switch off the ATM at the time of dispensation of cash and he suggested that the fraudsters might have used such an option. In this way they could convince the bank that notes were not dispensed owing to a system failure and demand refund,” said Navas, adding that the accused were sticking to their version. A demo with expert technicians will be held to see how exactly the fraud happens, he said. “The accused claimed that their technique works in the ATMs manufactured by a certain company. We will be interrogating the accused further to know the truth. Anyway, their accounts received money lately,” he said. Meanwhile, a senior banker, on condition of anonymity, said that fraud – as described by the accused – could be done. “This has happened before. At least, some old machines are still prone to this problem. If such a claim is made and fund is not transferred, bank would have to pay a penalty of Rs 100/day. So, most banks credit the sum right away. Once an enquiry reveals the truth, it would be too late,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Govt\u2019s aid schemes should be public.description: Kochi: State government schemes to aid citizens in distress should be given publicity so that they are not forced to reveal their distress to the public and seek their help or approach courts with litigations, the high court has said. Citizens in distress being pushed to helplessness and forced to seek indulgence of fellow citizens, with pictures of family members crying in deep despair, is an affront to the dignity of the citizenry as a whole. Therefore, the government must rise to the occasion and offer all support, Justice Devan Ramachandran said in an order. The court in its order said, “The information regarding these avenues are generally not available to the citizens at large and I am certain that many of them are, therefore, constrained to go public with their distress to seek the beneficence of fellow citizens and other non-governmental agencies.” The court considered a petition by 56-year-old Alavi Kunhalan of Kavarakundu in Malappuram. He had availed a loan of Rs 16 lakh from Malappuram District Cooperative Bank and defaulted in repayment due to extreme financial crisis. One of his two daughters is mentally challenged whereas the other one is suffering from a serious heart condition. Approaching the high court, he had sought to put coercive action by the bank on hold and to allow him to repay the loan in instalments. Following this, the court asked the government to inform what aid can be provided to the petitioner. Revenue department submitted that while the government cannot interfere in the SARFAESI proceedings initiated by the bank, aid can be provided under Chief Minister’s Distress Relief Scheme. Disability pension can be availed for the petitioner’s daughter. There is no scheme to aid those who fail to repay loans, the court was told. State attorney K V Sohan also submitted that the petitioner can seek assistance from Chief Minister’s Debt Relief Fund, Social Security Pension System, and Minority Development Corporation. As the petitioner’s counsel R Ranjith Manjeri submitted that his client wants to seek assistance under these schemes, the court postponed the case for two weeks. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Last rites of IAF Corporal killed in AN-.description: KANNUR: The funeral of Corporal Sharin N K, who was killed in an IAF aircraft AN-32 crash on June 3, will be conducted here on Friday. The body of the Corporal reached Kannur airport late on Thursday and it was taken to his native place at Kuzhimbalodu Motta near Anjarakkandy on Friday morning where it will be kept for the people to pay homage. The funeral would be held in the compound of his house only. Hundreds of people have thronged the place to pay their respect to the brave soldier. Sharin, son of PK Pavithran and Sreeja, had been working in Menchuka Air Force station in Arunachal Pradesh since 2017. The Russian-made IAF AN-32, carrying 13 IAF personnel was heading to Menchika from Jorhat in Assam when it went missing. IAF confirmed the death of all 13 onboard after 10 days when the debris were spotted in the hilly forest terrains of Arunachal Pradesh. Besides Sharin, Squadron Leader H Vinod from Thrissur, Sergeant Anoop Kumar from Kollam, were also among those killed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. No records on recovered land with revenu.description: KOCHI: In 2007, the then district collector of Ernakulam A P M Mohammed Hanish had launched a drive to evict encroachers from MG Road. Around 50 cents were recovered through the drive. However, 12 years later, the revenue department doesn't have any detail about the land recovered at an area that has high land value, shows an RTI reply. Not only that, many of the land parcels that were evicted during the drive has been encroached on again. In a reply to an RTI query submitted by T N Prathapan of Thammanam, Ernakulam village officer stated that the details regarding the land parcels which were recovered through an eviction in 2007 were not available at the village office. “As this office doesn’t have a file system, details regarding the eviction had not been codified and kept in the office,” the reply by the village officer stated. When contacted, the village officer gave the same answer. Following this, Prathapan has filed an appeal before Kanayannoor Tahsildar. In the reply, the taluk officials said that he would get a reply from Ernakulam village office in a couple of days. Ernakulam Vikasana Samathi, a forum for the development of the city, has demanded that the authorities should take measures for protecting the land. “Recently, a cent on MG Road has been sold at Rs 2 crore. At least 50 cents of land had been recovered through the eviction drive in 2007. Given the value of land in the area, assets running into crores of rupees are being alienated,” said K S Dileep Kumar, president, Ernakulam Vikasana Samithi. “The corporation should construct compound walls for protecting the holdings from encroachment,” he said. In many areas, the evicted areas are being encroached again. “Recently, a shop owner near Jayalakshmi Silks paved concrete tiles on the poramboke, which was seized from encroachers during 2007 drive. They extended the tile pavement in front of their shop to the poramboke land. When we raised an objection, the corporation removed the tiles from the government land. But this is not an isolated incident,” said Dileep Kumar. “A shopping complex has claimed right of way through the land in front of their building. When the corporation tried to recover the land, the building owners moved court,” said Sudha Dileep Kumar, councillor, Kochi Corporation. Once the land parcels are recovered from the encroachers, it can be used for purposes like constructing bus bays. This will avoid traffic snarls as well as accidents. Navy celebrates 60 years of its oldest a.description: KOCHI: The Indian Navy’s first Naval Air Squadron 550 celebrated its diamond jubilee at Naval Base in Kochi on Tuesday. The squadron has flown 14 different types of aircraft starting with the Sea Land to the Dornier maritime reconnaissance aircraft. The squadron has been part of several operations, from the 1971 Indo-Pak War to Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations during the December 2004 Tsunami, Cyclone Ockhi in 2017 and the 2018 Kerala floods. To commemorate the occasion, various outreach activities and community events were conducted by the squadron. These include an organ donation awareness lecture attended by the families of officers and sailors of the Southern Naval Command. A seminar on Technological Advancements to Mitigate Challenges in Airborne Maritime Reconnaissance was conducted at Sagarika in which Vice Admiral A K Chawla, Flag Officer Commanding in Chief, SNC, was the chief guest. As part of the celebrations, a trophy in memory of late Lieutenant Simon George Pynumootil was instituted by the family of the officer to be presented to the Most Spirited Officer of the Dornier Operational Flying Training course. This trophy was instituted to pay tribute to the officer who was a qualified Islander pilot and lost his life in a fatal air crash whilst serving in the squadron on May 17, 1985. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three held with hashish oil brought for.description: KOCHI: Three youths were arrested by the city shadow police after seizing several bottles of hashish oil from them on Tuesday. The accused were identified as Sharun (23) and Sarath (22) who are siblings, and Pranav (20), all hailing from Mulavukad. According to police, they were nabbed from near Container Terminal Road on their arrival from Bengaluru from where they reportedly brought the hashish oil kept in several bottles. “The drug was meant for supplying to a rave party to be held at a private resort in the city on Saturday,” said police. “The tip-off about the party was received after we arrested a youngster last week who was waiting for drug delivery at High Court Junction. We later made him lure out the suppliers by sealing a deal and sent them a map of the location through WhatsApp for exchange of drugs. The accused believed it and got trapped,” said police. Police have launched a probe against the resort owners. Ganja peddler arrested The special squad of Ernakulam excise division arrested a 34-year-old man on charges of possession and sale of ganja on Tuesday. The sleuths seized more than 2kg of ganja from the accused who was identified as Azad (34) of Kuttamasserry at Aluva West. According to excise officials, he was arrested based on the information provided by the top narcotic secret group led by inspector B Suresh. The officials said the accused left his job abroad recently and started selling drugs. They traced him from the details collected from a high school student, who was brought to the Vimukthi counselling centre at excise zonal office at Kacheripady by his parents when they found ganja in his schoolbag. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mumbai police to issue lookout notice ag.description: MUMBAI: Mumbai police has initiated the process of issuing a lookout notice against Binoy Kodiyeri, accused of rape and cheating by a Mumbai-based woman, even as they recorded a detailed statement from the complainant on Thursday to bolster the case. Two officials from Oshiwara police station in Mumbai who came to Kannur two days ago for recording Binoy's statement have so far failed to trace him. A Mumbai police officer told TOI that since Binoy seemed unlikely to appear for questioning, they have initiated the process of intimating immigration authorities to detain him at any airport in the country he tries to flee from. Oshiwara police on Thursday summoned the complainant and recorded her statement. The woman was accompanied by her sister, a witness in the case, and they were present at the police station from 1.30pm to 3.30pm. The complainant also submitted to the police recordings of her conversation with Binoy a few months ago. "In the conversation, Binoy is heard telling the complainant not to aggravate the matter and promised to settle the matter once he is in Mumbai. He also took an assurance from her that she would destroy all documents where his name is mentioned,'' an official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. Narendra Modi.description: RANCHI: Appealing to people to take yoga to all sections of society, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said yoga is above everything, as he performed various asanas with around 40,000 enthusiasts at the Prabhat Tara ground here to mark the fifth International Day of Yoga. Modi also urged people to make yoga an integral part of life. International Yoga Day 2019: PM urges country to embrace Yoga"We should make efforts to take yoga from cities to villages and tribal areas. Yoga is above religion, caste, colour, gender and region, it is above everything," he told the gathering. Yoga is ancient and modern. It is constant and evolving. For centuries, the essence of Yoga has remained the same… https://t.co/isvMOUTrn8— PMO India (@PMOIndia) 1561080804000The main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Best pictures from International Yoga Day 2019"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Follow live updates: International Yoga DayThe main event for the yoga day was held at the Jharkhand capital. Amit Shah credits PM for taking yoga to the world"It (yoga) is constant and evolving for centuries. The essence of yoga has been stable and remained the same -- healthy body, stable mind, spirit of oneness. Yoga has provided a perfect blend of knowledge, karma and bhakti," the prime minister said. Events to mark the day are being held across the globe and in India, several of them are being led by Union ministers, including Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh. Modi also said the government has been working to make yoga a pillar of preventive healthcare. Expressing concern that young people are becoming vulnerable to heart ailments, Modi said, "Yoga can play a huge role in tackling the issue and hence, this year's theme is 'Yoga for Heart'." "It is painful to read about alcoholism, substance abuse, diabetes and other things, adding yoga offers a solution to these problems," he added. He stressed that for yoga to become popular, infrastructure for it must be strengthened and said the government was working towards it. "Peace and harmony are related to yoga. People across the world must practice it," Modi said. The prime minister had arrived in Ranchi on Thursday night. On his way out of the venue, Modi shook hands with several participants, including school children, who reached out to the prime minister over barricades. The International Day of Yoga is being celebrated annually on June 21 since 2015. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. District collector issues order to recov.description: KOCHI: District collector K Mohammed Y Safirulla passed an order on Wednesday, upholding the order of the additional tahsildar of Kanayannur to take back 82.250 cents occupied by Lotus Club, stating that the club had failed to furnish documents to prove its ownership. He issued the order after hearing an appeal filed by office-bearers of the club, challenging the orders issued by the additional tahsildar and Fort Kochi’s subcollector to recover the said land on Warriam Road. In an order issued on February 2, 2010 under Kerala Land Conservancy Act, the additional tahsildar said that the club has occupied puramboke land as per revenue records. Since it exists on encroached land, it should be vacated. The club secured a stay on the order and approached the Ernakulam sub court and filed a revision petition before revenue authorities citing that the land was given by the king of erstwhile kingdom of Kochi. But, nothing went in their favour. Club authorities then approached Fort Kochi subcollector, who is the appellate authority, to challenge the order. But the sub-collector—in his order in April 2018 — upheld the order of the additional tahsildar. As per the basic tax register and puramboke register, 80.25 cents in the survey number 740/2 of Ernakulam village in Kanayannur taluk is government land and it was encroached by the club, the sub-collector said. Then, the club moved the high court which ordered the district collector to hear the review petition filed by the club and issue an appropriate order. Based on the court order, Safirulla considered the matter and found that the club lacked documents to prove the ownership of the land. The club claimed that the erstwhile kingdom had even granted timber for the construction of the club house. “I haven’t seen the order issued by the district collector. So, I don’t want to comment on the issue. The land was given to us by the Maharaja of Kochi and the club began in 1931. We rebuilt the structure in 70s and government and local body gave us all necessary approvals,” said secretary of the club Joseph Kurian Pooppally, when the collector’s order was brought to his notice.
