Plastic is literally everywhere: 1,057 t.description: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: If ever the state cleans up its coastal area, it will have to remove roughly 1,057 tonnes of plastic litter, showed a recent study conducted by environmental NGO Thanal. The study on plastic litter along Kerala coast found that single-use plastic posed a threat not just to cities and towns but also the coast. The study report, released in June, covered 59 sample sites in coastal areas of seven districts. It found that single use plastic accounted for 53% of plastic litter on beaches whereas multi-use materials stood next at 22%of the plastic waste in coastal areas. Food & snacks, home/personal care, tobacco products, utilities and plastic waste from medical care activities were considered as single-use plastics, while fishing equipment and plastic waste from construction activities were considered as multi-use plastics. Of the single-use lot, food & snacks is the major contributor of plastic waste, which raises concerns over the quantity of waste left on the beach by visitors. The state’s aggressive campaign for green protocol seems to have had little impact as the number of plastic carry bags stood at 85.54 lakh pieces. The study found that carry bags are finding its way into fragile environmental zones. Lack of bins was another major problem. A senior pollution control board (PCB) official said that solid waste management rules (2016) said that vendors must have bins to collect waste generated from their business and then deposit in storage depots as notified by the local body. “Absence of bins has been a major problem on beaches in the state. People and vendors just throw the waste around. Plastic never undergoes degradation, it gets broken into nano particles over the years or will be washed up by the sea. This raises far greater concerns as it may enter the food chain,” he said. The study spanning six months was done by a five-member team of Thanal who also prepared litter indices in terms of number and weight of plastic that was found along the coast. It also pointed at a bigger challenge: undesignated plastic, i.e. litter that remained on beach for a long time that is impossible to categorize. Withering of plastics on the beach made it impossible to identify the origin/type/polymer on inspection. “Identifying the type was a major challenge as it had remained there for so long. This is one of the biggest contributors of plastic litter along Kerala coast,” said Thanal’s deputy programme officer Sujith Surendran, also a member of the team. Every square metre of beach in the state has 10.31g of plastic waste. The team took samples of plastic litter from 59 locations at regular intervals of 10km. At every location, litter was collected between the shoreline and first line of vegetation/built-up land. District-wise litter index was calculated and Malappuram topped the list as most-littered while Alappuzha was the least-littered one. Programme coordinator Thanal Nikhilesh Paliath, who was a member of the study team, said monsoon brought more challenges as unremoved plastic litter would mix with the sea, endangering marine ecosystem. Most sample locations had rural residential settlement and fishing activity which justified the presence of consumer products and fishing-related material in plastic litter. It was also observed that portions of beach – adjacent to residential dwellings – had higher concentration of plastic litter. “Coastal belt is a sensitive corridor as characteristics of aquatic ecosystem and land ecosystem merge on this belt. It is absolutely terrible to find that 17 crore plastic pieces pollute such a sensitive corridor,” said NGO’s executive director Jayakumar C. Environmentalists advocate reduction of single-use plastic as key solution. Environmentalist Shibu KN – who guided the study –said that every stakeholder in coastal zone must take up initiatives for responsible disposal of plastic waste to protect these zones. Jaya DS at University of Kerala’s environmental sciences department said that single-use plastic must be reduced by a proper collection mechanism. “Recently, the fisheries department started an initiative to provide incentives to fishermen who bring back plastic found at sea. Earlier, they would leave it and microplastics could kill fishes and birds. Reducing single-use plastic is the only way ahead,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No nepotism involved in appointment of m.description: KOCHI: State government has contended before the Kerala high court that there was no nepotism involved in the appointment of higher education minister KT Jaleel’s cousin KT Adeeb to a senior post in a state-run corporation. The government was responding to a petition (WP-C No. 10262/2019) filed by PK Firos of Kozhikode seeking a probe against the minister under provisions of Prevention of Corruption Act. Adeeb was appointed as general manager at Kerala State Minority Development Finance Corporation Ltd. A statement filed by minorities welfare department through state attorney KV Sohan said, “There is no corruption, favouritism, nepotism or illegality in the matter of appointment of Sri. Adeeb KT. There is absolutely no undue advantage obtained by the minister or anybody else before or after the appointment in issue.” Notification for the job opening was published in Chandrika, Madhyamam, and Deshabhimani dailies on August 27, 2016. Though another applicant, Saheer Kaladi, was invited for the interview on October 26, 2016, he did not attend the interview. While the qualification prescribed was MBA in marketing or finance or CS/CA/ICWAI with 3 years experience, MBA (HR) and BTech with PGDBA was also included on August 25, 2016. As Adeeb had the required qualification, he was appointed following recommendation to the government by the company’s board on September 11, 2018. An NOC was obtained from assistant general manager of South Indian Bank, where Adeeb was working. Adeeb later requested to be relieved and the corporation’s board requested the government to relieve him on November 13, 2018 and it was accepted on November 16, government said in the statement. The row over the appointment had surfaced early in November 2018. Government also informed the court that there was nothing wrong in Adeeb requesting annual incentive bonus and other allowances. Only an unsigned complaint was submitted before Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau by email on November 3rd and the government concluded that there is no necessity of conducting an enquiry. Meena Menon protests KSEB move.description: KOCHI: On Wednesday Meena Menon, the owner of Shanthivanam, cut her hair short to protest against the state government and KSEB’s move to cut down trees on her land. She added that she would give her clump of hair to the chief minister, power minister and KSEB as a mark of protest. “My action is an example of what will happen when an ordinary citizen tries to protect the environment. I have raised a lot of slogans for the party. Comrade, this is for the common man and what is happening is a violation of human rights,” she said. She had been protesting along with other environmentalists against KSEB’s move to fell trees to construction of a 11kV tower on her land. On Tuesday, Menon had said she would do so after KSEB officials informed that they would start felling trees, including 200-year-old ones, from Wednesday. A total of eight trees were to be pulled down. On Wednesday morning, Shanthivanam samrakshana Samiti protested when KSEB officials arrived. They went away and came back with a bigger police force and later started cutting down the branches of the big trees. “I have fought using all possible ways democratically. I don’t need permission to cut my hair and I am doing it. I have been waiting for the chief minister to intervene. This is how the government is planning to make the state green. When they want the land, they will just wipe out all biodiversity,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Apartment owners allege 1996 CRZ map was.description: KOCHI: Residents of Alfa Serene apartment, facing the threat of demolition, have said that the 1996 Coastal Zone Mapping (CZMP), on the basis of which the property in which they reside has been deemed illegal, was crude, inaccurate and full of errors. The Supreme Court had on May 8 ordered the demolition of the four high rises at Maradu, including Alfa Serene, citing the violation of coastal regulation zone (CRZ) norms. Addressing a news meet here, Alfa Serene Apartment Owners’ Association said the 1996 map was so crude that it was difficult to identify a place. “It is unlike the map prepared in 2012 by Maradu municipality, in which the building and CR zones can be clearly identified by the survey numbers,” said association president Rasheed Usman. The press conference was also attended by association secretary Sen Eapen and Sooraj Krishna, a resident. “It mentioned that the area comes under CRZ-3, which is defined as relatively undisturbed rural area. But the area in which the apartment is located is more developed than some of the Cochin corporation areas,” said Krishna. “In 2003 itself the Kerala high court had said that the 1996 map is basic and so illegible that no definite conclusions can be made with such mapping,” he said. “What is the minimum guarantee for people like us? We relied on the approval documents given to us by the builder and the due diligence done by the banks who have given loans. The sub-registrar office collected the stamp duty paid by us, the municipality collected building tax from us, the village office collected land tax from us, KSEB is collecting charges for electricity, oil companies are collecting LPG charges, Kerala Water Authority is collecting water charges from us. So, we have been living in this community as legitimate owners,” said Krishna. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kerala's Alappuzha municipality is givin.description: ALAPPUZHA: Alappuzha municipality's 'Thinkal' project is getting good response .As part of the project, the municipality is giving 5000 menstrual cups free of cost to women in a bid to curb the growing problem of menstrual waste.  Alapppuzha municipal secretary S Jahamgeer said that the municipality that kicked off the project on Saturday is now daily distributing 500 menstrual cups and daily the distribution finishing by mid of the day. "We have stored 5000 menstrual cups. But daily we are distributing only 500. Otherwise, people will misuse, and even medical store people may come and buy it. We are distributing it from the front office of the municipality and Kudumbashree office at Kaichoondimukku. Any woman can buy it after presenting an ID card and they should register their names in any of these two offices with the phone number. Then they will get menstrual cup of Rs 600. It can be reused for a period of up to five years. The demand for the cup is increasing. So we will daily distribute more than 500 cups," he said. "This is the first phase of this project and under this, 5,000 menstrual cups will be given. This project is being executed as a means for the effective waste management system. This one cup can replace as many as 780 sanitary napkins. So through 5,000 cups, we are preventing 39 lakh sanitary napkins which will come as the waste after it use. Under second phase of the project, we will give reusable pads made of clothes," he said. This project is being executed by Alappuzha municipality in association with the Hindustan Latex Limited. It is funded under the Corporate Social Responsibility initiative of the Coal India Limited. Finance minister T M Thomas Isaac inaugurated this project. Alappuzha municipality has already received global attention for its effective waste management system. Alappuzha was among five cities of the world whose projects to end the problem of solid waste have been recognised as success stories by the United Nations environment body UNEP. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Maradu councillors blame KWA for damaged.description: TRIPUNITHURA: Upset over the frequent digging of roads by the Kerala Water Authority (KWA) to lay pipelines, the councillors of Maradu municipality, led by chairperson T H Nadeera, gheraoed the office of KWA assistant engineer on Wednesday. The protesting councillors were later arrested by the Hill Palace police. The UDF-ruled Maradu municipality was upset that the KWA was repairing roads only in the wards represented by LDF councillors. “At a special meeting on May 6, M Swaraj, MLA, had promised a sum of Rs 2.83 crore for restoration of municipal roads damaged due to KWA pipe laying works. However, the KWA behaved in a partisan manner and started road repair works in the wards represented by LDF councillors,” said Nadeera. “With the onset of monsoon, majority of the municipal roads have become unmotorable,” said municipality vice-chairman Boban Nedumparambil. They now plan to take up the matter with the water resources minister. Councillors stage protest against water shortageCouncillors of Cheranalloor panchayat on Wednesday protested in front of the Kerala Water Authority office as the area faces shortage of drinking water supply. Councillors said residents in the area have been relying on tanker trucks for the past 12 days for drinking water as the KWA failed to pump water to the area. Around eight UDF councillors laid siege to the superintendent engineer of KWA in Ernakulam demanding to increase the time of pumping from Aluva. “If officials increase the rate of pumping, residents in the panchayat will get water,” said ward member Raju C K. The siege ended after officials promised that residents would get water from Friday onwards. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sree Sankara dance school's Vision 2020.description: Seven new choreographic dances were staged by 21 young upcoming professional dancers at Vision 2020, a new cultural venture by Kalady-based Sree Sankara School of Dance at Changampuzha Park, Edappally.Vision 2020 aims to identify and promote professional dancers. The programme commenced with Adi Sankaras famous work ‘Ganesha Pancharatnam’ and also performances based on Rajeev Alungal’s poem and Narayana Guru’s works ‘Kundalinippattu’, ‘Kali natakam’ and ‘Siva Prasad Panchakam’. Jessni Varghese visualised the famous bhajan ‘Radha Samedha Krishna’.C P Unnikrishnan directed the programme, M S Unnikrishnan was music director, Sudha Peethambaran was on nattuvangam, Sreekumar Urakam gave vocal support, RLV Venu Kurumassery was on mrudangam, Edappally Anilkumar and Baburaj Perumabavoor were on violin and keyboard.In Video:Sree Sankara School performanceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Postal ballot fraud: HC grants time to E.description: KOCHI: The Kerala high court on Tuesday granted three more weeks to Election Commission to hand over records related to postal ballot fraud to crime branch. A division bench comprising chief justice Hrishikesh Roy and justice AK Jayasankaran Nambiar granted time as the election commission informed that more time is required to sort the votes polled by policemen on duty outside their home district during the Lok Sabha election. The court is considering a public interest litigation (PIL) filed by opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala seeking a probe by an independent commission. In a statement filed in the court, the election commission had stated that three forms (12, 13B, 13C) related to postal ballot can be inspected by the investigation officer whereas form 13A, which contains the declaration by electors and attestation of their signatures should not be opened or their contents should not be inspected by or produced before any person or authority except under the order of a competent court. Urgent instructions are being issued to district election officers or returning officers to furnish the three forms to the investigating officer and to cooperate with the probe so as to facilitate the investigation to reach its logical conclusion at the earliest, the statement filed by election commission’s counsel Murali Purushothaman said. It is alleged in the PIL that over 55,000 proxy votes were polled by representatives of Left-aligned Kerala Police Association by misusing postal votes of police officials who were on duty outside their home districts on the election day. The court has scheduled a hearing in the case after three weeks. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PWD carries out repair work of Vaduthala.description: KOCHI: A day after TOI reported about the pathetic state of approach road of Vaduthala-Chittoor bridge, PWD carried out repair works. TOI on Sunday had carried an article about rodents digging up holes in the approach road thereby posing threat to the safety of the bridge.  On Tuesday, PWD officials closed the holes using concrete and quarry waste and repaired the damaged portion. “When we raised the issue, PWD had maintained that city corporation is the owner of the approach road and so the civic body should carry out the repair works,” said O P Sunil, councillor representing Vaduthala division in the corporation. “Then, I sent a complaint to PWD minister G Sudhakaran,” said Sunil. “Following this, PWD officials initiated steps to repair the damaged portion. They also replaced old dilapidated slabs on the drains in the area with new ones,” Sunil said. A three-member team of engineers from PWD (Bridges) had inspected the site on Friday and sent a mail to the Kochi corporation demanding immediate rectification of the damages on the approach road. “On Monday, we repaired the approach road. When the slabs of the approach road were removed, we could see a large hole between the slabs and pack of rocks which served as a retaining wall of the elevated portion of the approach road. Rodents were seen rushing out from the hole,” a PWD official said. “It is only a temporary measure taken considering the safety of the bridge. Now, we will have to do a proper repair of the bridge. For this, we need funds,” she said. The PWD officials have also asked the local body to stop dumping waste near the approach road of the bridge. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Removing unauthorized boards: HC orders.description: KOCHI: The Kerala High Court has ordered Kottayam district police chief to conduct a probe into alleged illegal detention of Kottayam municipality secretary by union leaders of MG University for removing flex boards of university festival. Justice Devan Ramachandran ordered the district police chief to launch an investigation after considering a letter petition stating that the municipality secretary J Muhammed Shafi was unlawfully detained for about an hour by a gang of eight persons who claimed to be union leaders of MG University by trespassing into his official residence. The gang had allegedly detained him without allowing him to make any phone calls and had attacked the health squad of the municipality that reached his residence then. It was demanded by the gang that the municipal secretary should reinstall the unauthorized boards put up in connection with the university festival and the boards were forcefully taken from the secretary’s custody and reinstalled by the gang in different parts of the town, the letter received at the high court said. On February 26th last year, the high court had issued a common order directing secretaries of local self-government institutions to remove all unauthorized flex boards, advertisement boards, banners, flag, and hoardings in public spaces and streets in the state. The order had also asked district collectors to inspect the territory under their jurisdiction and initiate action and also directed the state police chief to ensure that all station house officers are instructed to register cases against entities and persons who erect unauthorized boards, banners, flags, and hoardings. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tackling single-use plastic: Technical c.description: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: While there is a growing demand for reducing single-use plastic, the technical committee – constituted by the state government for enlisting plastic products to be banned – has pitched a ‘return-and-earn’ scheme (container return deposit refund (CRDR) scheme) for plastic carry bags and bottles, modelled on foreign nations. This was found in a report obtained through RTI. In this system, a surcharge/additional payment on the plastic item purchased is received and rebate/refund/payback is given when it is returned. For example: part of a drink’s price would be returned when the customer returns the empty bottle. Germany and Denmark already have such a scheme in place and the bottle return rate is 90%. The return reward amount is printed on the bottle, said the committee. The report further said that a returnable deposit can be levied on plastic bags. “The retailer returns the deposit to whoever returns the bag. The return reward amount is printed on the bag. All retailers who sell plastic bags are obliged to buy back the bags. All retailers that sell bottled drinks (including mineral water) are obliged to buy back empty bottles. The subsequent links in the return chain shall be the responsibility of distributor and producer,” it said. However, environmentalists questioned the practicality of such a system in state. “This deposit refund system was earlier used during the conduct of events recently in the capital. We are talking about long-term plan and it needs to be seen how much the society warms up to this concept,” said an environmentalist. The committee was jittery about imposing a complete ban considering the enormous investment in the plastic industry. Kerala has 820 units with a capital investment of Rs 145.7 crore, employing 3,800 workers who are engaged in the production of single-use plastic. As per the report, the committee considered economic aspects and job loss from outright ban on single-use plastics. Plastic carry bags, bottles, paper cups and plates, which account for a major share of plastic litter, have investments worth Rs 75 crore and employ nearly 2,000 people. TOI had earlier reported that the committee had submitted a conflicting report on the ban on plastic products. The report showed the committee recommending a ban on just three products: plastic flags, plastic decorative festoons, single-use food plates, cups and tetra packs. The report carried an annexure on suggestions filed by P Kalaiarasan, environmental engineer, department of environment and climate change. It had a dedicated a legal framework to regulate single-use plastic products in state. The government constituted a fivemember technical expert committee to make a list of plastic products that can be brought under the ambit of a complete ban. The convener recommended that 17 products be banned. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tamil Nadu says 'no' to Kerala's drinkin.description: CHENNAI: A row is brewing over Kerala's offer of a trainload of water to Tamil Nadu to tide over the acute scarcity. Kerala says Tamil Nadu turned down the offer of 20 lakh litres of water made on Thursday, but Tamil Nadu denies this and says it's waiting for chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami to return from hospital to decide. For his part, opposition leader and DMK chief M K Stalin thanked the Kerala government for its offer and urged the Tamil Nadu government to work with the neighbouring state. A statement from Kerala chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan's office said the state was prepared to send 20 lakh litres by train from Thiruvananthapuram to Chennai. "Since the major water bodies of Chennai has been facing acute water shortage, the Kerala government decided to extend an helping hand," it said adding that the Tamil Nadu chief minister's office had replied that there was no need for help at present. In a series of tweets later in the day, Tamil Nadu water supply minister S P Velumani said the Kerala CM's secretary called up his TN counterpart and made a "one-time offer" of water supply in 20 rail wagons. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ernakulam: Operation Monsoon to check dr.description: KOCHI: Considering the high probability of increase in the inflow of drugs and tobacco products during monsoon, the Ernakulam excise division has launched a special drive called Operation Monsoon led by deputy commissioner of excise K Chandra Palan to nab smugglers. The decision is in the wake of more smuggling cases being reported in the division, especially during night time. According to officials, the drive is also expected to strengthen surveillance around schools as the new academic year has begun. “Monsoon season normally witnesses increase in smuggling cases. Smugglers consider it an ideal time as patrolling and vehicle inspections could be affected by the rains. Moreover, the tight security surveillance employed during election season, which reduced crime rate over the past two months, is now over. So, there is a need to boost up patrolling,” Palan said. Vehicle checking and night patrols will be strengthened across the district and the excise department will join hands with railway protection force to conduct search operations in railway stations to monitor passengers and cargo transport. Separate units of striking force will also be deployed round the clock to act in case of any untoward incidents. Moreover, it targets to crack down on medical shops which sell drugs like Nitrazepam and Alprazolam tablets without any authorized medical prescription. This is following the information collected from some of the accused in recent cases who said that some of the medical shops are assisting smugglers. “The top narcotic secret group of Ernakulam excise division has been gathering intelligence about the drug suppliers in the city and found that ganja and Nitrazepam tablets are easily available for students, especially those studying in higher secondary level. On Tuesday, we arrested one such supplier after the details collected from a high school student, who underwent counselling at the excise Vimukthi counselling centre when his parents found ganja packet in his schoolbag. Drug menace among students is a major challenge that needs to be checked,” said Palan. The official also said that excise officials would be part of parent-teacher meetings in schools in the district. “The School Protection Groups are already associating with excise to help counsel student and gather information,” Palan said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

DYFI meet to discuss woman\u2019s resign.description: PALAKKAD: The upcoming district committee meet of DYFI will discuss the resignation of the woman member of the youth wing, who had complained of sexual harassment against party MLA P K Sasi. The woman from Mannarkkad had complained of sexual harassment against the Shoranur MLA, following which the later was suspended from the party for six months. During the two-day camp of the DYFI on Saturday and Sunday at Elappully, the DYFI district committee was reconstituted by allegedly demoting some of the party members who had supported the woman. The complainant had tendered her resignation following the move on Sunday. T M Sasi, the new district secretary of DYFI, said the issue of resignation would be taken up in the next district committee meet. He added that the reconstitution of the committee was a normal procedure followed in the organization and it was used to promote people on merit and demote those who do not discharge their responsibilities efficiently. The woman’s complaint against the MLA, who is also a secretariat member of the party district committee, was a major embarrassment for the CPM and DYFI and there were differences within the committee as some members supported the woman and demanded stern action against the MLA. The resignation is also said to be in protest against the elevation of a DYFI leader as the district vice-president, who was accused of tarnishing the image of the woman leader through social media. The MLA was suspended for six months from the party on November 26 after an inquiry commission appointed by the party, consisting of minister A Balan and P K Sreemathi found him guilty. As the punishment period was over, the party is learned to be considering to take him back. But the fresh controversy and the humiliating defeat of the Left in the Lok Sabha polls are likely to delay his reinduction. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kumarakom sees fall in tourist footfall.description: Kottayam: Popular tourist destination Kumarakom is craving for tourists this monsoon. There has been a sharp fall in the number of tourists this season according to tour operators and owners of houseboats and resorts in Kumarakom. The occupancy of rooms is far below 50%. Hoping for a change in fortune by next month, the stakeholders want the government to take some initiatives to rejuvenate the sector. Salim Das, president of Vembanad Chamber of Hotels and Resorts, said even the weekends are dull and the sector is facing a crisis. Das cited Nipah scare as one of the main reason for the fall in the footfall. “Along with Nipah fear, the economic depression could also be one reason,” he added. Now people are opting shikara boats to house boats to cut down the cost,” he said. Also, the GST is too high in the country and this is forcing tourists to opt for destinations outside the country, he said. “The tax which was 12.5% earlier had now risen to 18-28%,” he said. Sreekumar, a tour operator in Kumarakom, said it has been a downward trend in June. “Usually during this time, we used to get a good number of tourists from the metro cities in the country. But now, there has been hardly 50% occupancy in the resorts,” he said. Sreekumar, who was on a trip to Goa to study the sector there, lauded the initiatives of the Goan tourism department which has helped the industry there. “This season, the Goan tourism department has launched several attractions like hot air balloon ride and bungee jumping. They have also started a mobile app for availing taxi service. There are also casinos in cruise ships,” he said.  “We are lagging far behind when compared to destinations like Goa. We are only marketing tourism and not taking any initiative to improve,” he said. Shanej Indraprastham, a houseboat owner, said there has been no new bookings for houseboats. “Usually we used to get domestic tourists this month. By July there used to be a good flow of Arab tourists. But there has been no bookings so far,” he said. Indraprastham also said the houseboat industry is facing a crisis as there has been a shortage of staff. After the floods, the industry was dull and many staff left the job and joined other places. We can’t employ migrant workers in houseboats,” he added. There are around 120 houseboats operating in Kumarakom. Biju Varghese, deputy director, tourism department, said the department is doing state-level marketing of the tourism sector. He also hoped that the turnout of tourists will increase this monsoon. “There was an increase in the number of tourists in the first three months of the year compared to the same period last year,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. In Video:No communication on H-1B visa cap from US: Commerce ministryDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Business News.

Murdered cop Soumya cremated.description: Alappuzha: The cremation of civil police officer (CPO) Soumya Puspakaran (34), who was brutally murdered by CPO N A Ajas (33) was held on the premises of her house at 11.30am on Thursday. Her body was kept at Vallikunnam police station from 9am to 10am for her colleagues and public to pay their tributes. Ajas, who was undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital, succumbed to his burn injuries on Wednesday evening and his body was handed over to his kin after completing legal and medical formalities at 5pm on Thursday. As per the autopsy report, burn injuries and sudden cardiac arrest caused his death, the police said. Soumya, who was working at Vallikunnam police station, was murdered by Ajas, a civil police officer attached to Aluva traffic police station, on Saturday near her home at Thekkemuri of Vallikunnam grama panchayat. According to the police, Ajas, who was waiting in a rented car, in front of Soumya’s home, rammed her scooter and knocked her down. Seeing Ajas alight from the car, Soumya tried to flee but Ajas attacked her with a sword, poured petrol over her body and set her on fire using a cigarette lighter. Soumya leaves behind husband Sajeev and children Rishikesh, Adhisesh and Ridhika. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Thiruvananthapuram commissioner has no c.description: KOCHI: Thiruvananthapuram city police commissioner's report that election to police cooperative society would result in violence shows he lacks control over policemen, says the Kerala High Court. The court has now sought the views of state police chief in the matter. The possibility of violence between police personnel was highlighted by the commissioner in a letter sent to Kerala State Cooperative Election Commission. After perusing the letter, justice Devan Ramachandran said in an interim order, "I must say that the contents of this letter make very disquieting reading. This is because, this is a society of Civil Police Officers and a responsible Commissioner of Police says that the members of the society are likely to be at war with each other physically, leading to 'major law and order issues'. The irony is that this is stated by the Commissioner of Police against Civil Police Officers, clearly indicating that he has little control over rank and file." After making state police chief a party in the case suo motu, the court has asked him to inform views about the police commissioners allegations by Friday. A petition filed by P Prathapachandran through senior advocate George Poonthottam is being considered by the court. Postponement of election to Police Cooperative Society Ltd was sought by the petitioner as local elections are to be held on the dance day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gowri Amma turns 100 today.description: ALAPPUZHA: K R Gowri, who was elected with a thumping majority to the Thiru-Kochi legislative assembly in 1952 and was the member of the first democratically elected Communist government in 1957, turns 100 on Friday as per Malayalam calendar. And to mark the occasion, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan will inaugurate the celebrations here to honour her. Gowri, born on ‘Thiruvonam’ day of Midhunam in 1094 as per Malayalam calendar (July 14, 1919) at Pattanakkad in Cherthala, was the seventh child of Kalathiparambil Raman and Paravathi Amma. She completed her schooling at TD School, Thuravoor and Cherthala English School. She did her graduation from Maharaja’s College and St. Teresa’s College. She secured LLB from Law College, Thiruvananthapuram. Gowri’s initial foray into politics was through students’ union and Communist party. She was the revenue minister in EMS Namboodiripad-led Communist government in 1957 and introduced the Land Reforms Bill. A former CPM leader, Gowri is now the head of Janathipatya Samrakshana Samiti (JSS) — the party that she founded after she was expelled from CPM in 1994. According to Gowri, “She doesn’t have the body language or ‘polish’ of current politicians. I am a rough person and as a result I have created many enemies and friends. I know that when many love me, there are a lot who hate me.’’ Besides the chief minister, opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala will preside over the event to honour her. Former chief minister V S Achuthanandan will release a documentary about her. Former chief minister Oommen Chandy will inaugurate the K R Gowri Amma Foundation and assembly speaker P Sreeramakrishnan will release a book about her. Holiday for assembly today: Thiruvananthapuram: In a rare gesture, the state assembly on Thursday announced a holiday on Friday so that members can take part in the centenary birthday celebrations of K R Gowri at Alappuzha. Soon after question hour, Speaker P Sreeramakrishnan invited the attention of the House and read out a statement noting that Gowri’s centenary birthday celebrations are to take place at Alappuzha on Friday. Earlier, CM Pinarayi Vijayan, while congratulating Gowri, noted that many members were planning to attend the celebrations and suggested postponing Friday’s session. With opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala also agreeing, the Speaker announced the holiday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three generations of alumni come togethe.description: Clad in a saffron sari adorned with rudraksha ornaments, the member of the erstwhile Travancore royal family, Pooyam Tirunal Gouri Parvathi Bayi represented a sage on stage. She was one of the 87 performers at the alumni event organised by the Old Students Association (OSA) of the Government Women’s College, Thiruvananthapuram. Titled Vasthrayana, the dance drama themed on the evolution of garments in India was a visual treat for those in attendance at the Karthika Tirunal Auditorium, recently. The cultural extravaganza saw performances of three generations of students, from the previous pre-degree batches to the recent graduates. Hundreds of alumni including homemakers, working professionals, artistes and bureaucrats, joined the performers at the venue to take a stroll down memory lane to relive their campus life. While those who had become great grandmothers enjoyed watching the show, many were looking around for their old batchmates. Though time had changed their physical appearance, many still found their pals, by calling out their nicknames. Singer Kanchana Sreeram, BA Music graduate of the 2017 batch, portrayed a South Indian bride on the show and says the event gave her friendship goals. “At a time when video calls and group chats are the norm, this alumni group stands apart because the reunion is held regularly without fail. I am happy I could see our super seniors and their seniors still joke around like in their younger days. I think they were the most enthusiast bunch at the event,” she says. “I was also surprised to see the performance of Princess Gouri Parvathi Bhayi, who danced flawlessly.” The dance drama narrated the evolution of garments with time — from the stone age to contemporary dressing styles. The event was held under the guidance of Pooyam Tirunal Gouri Parvathi Bayi, who is the OSA secretary. “The show is held every two years. The 87 members who were part of this show were of different ages and from all walks of life. We had grandmothers and mothers alongside granddaughters and daughters. It was hard work but fun too. Our dance director Aswathy Nair worked tirelessly to ensure seamless production and Ambili Ramnath’s expertise with words and Kavalam Sreekumar’s magic with the music have always been the mainstay of our performances,” she says. Apart from performing, for Gouri Parvathi Bayi, it is also an event to meet her friends and teachers. “I have never really left the Women’s College - as a student, teacher and as part of the Alumni association, I have always remained in touch with the institution. For most of us, there is a sense of homecoming when we step into the college compound. The years fall away, and we feel rejuvenated. Ultimately in life, our real earnings are the friendships we have forged, the wonderful experiences nobody can take away from us and precious memories that stay with us always. Many of our older members make it a point to come to our meetings and events. They make a greater physical effort than youngsters who work a full day and have homes to run too,” she adds. Actress Sona Nair was also part of the event, enthralling her friends in her avatar as goddess Saraswati. “This is an event that I eagerly look forward to. I feel blessed meeting my old teachers and classmates, and giving me memories to cherish for the next two years. Each of the 87 artistes were given a three-and-half-minute performance and so that ensured everyone had equal time to perform,” she says, adding that she always makes it a point to find time amid her shooting schedules to make it to the reunion. Photo Courtesy: Satheeshan Karicheri In Video:Three generations of alumni come together for a memorable bashDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Muvattupuzha-Kaloor chain service launch.description: KOCHI: KSRTC has launched a chain service from its Muvattupuzha depot linking Pattimattam, Kizhakambalam and Kakkanad with Kaloor. Buses in the chain service will operate every 15 minutes bringing relief to hundreds of passengers who had to suffer hardships in the absence of proper connectivity. KSRTC has pledged 16 limited stop ordinary buses to run the service. The route is a revenue-earner for KSRTC and currently there are 40 trips every day. The number of trips have gone up to 56 with the launch of the chain service. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Fish farmers in Ernakulam take to sale o.description: KOCHI: Inland fish farmers, who are struggling to sell their produce in the absence of marketing avenues, have reason to cheer as a new trend of live fish sales is fast catching up. A handful of young fish farmers have embarked on sale of live fish either at their own farms or specific sales points near highways or small towns. Advantages are many: Consumers can get chemical-free fish fresh from the nets and since there are no middlemen, farmers can earn a good revenue. But it can be risky if there are not enough sales because frequent transfer from ponds and life fish sale tanks can stress out the fish. Such sales outlets have come up in areas like Perumbavoor and Kothamangalam, which have lot of inland fish farms. “We are getting a lot of calls from farmers who want to know whether we can sell their fish,” said Shaji Varghese, a farmer associated with Farmers’ Facilitation Centre, formed under Sanskara, a cultural organization at Kothamangalam. Varghese, who works as a promoter under Fish Farmer Development Agency (FFDA) and owns a farm at Varapettty said the outlet could solve a major issue faced by fish farmers. His live fish sale outlet was recently moved to a plot near Bishop’s House at Kothamangalam in the highway. Encouraged by the prospects, more farmers are joining the bandwagon. Dhanesh, who grows fish at Methala village, has gone one step further and introduced mobile live fish sale to reach out to more customers. “The response so far was quite good but we should have a minimum sale of 50kg every day if it is to be profitable since I am using a hired vehicle,” said Dhanesh. While there are many takers for live fish, lack of diversity is a problem. Most farmers sell only Gift Tilapia and buyers who look for variety may find it disappointing. Some buyers have an aversion to inland farmed fish because of the feeling that they are less tasty. “The fish tastes good if it is farmed scientifically with proper feed. But most farmers tend to feed fish with chicken waste because fish feed tends to be costly,” said Renju, who has a farm at Kothamangalam and sells around 40kg of fish every day. Idukki church officials remove wooden cr.description: IDUKKI: The wooden crosses, which were erected atop the hills of Panchalimedu tourism point, were removed by church officials on Tuesday. Earlier, Hindu Aikyavedi had filed a complaint before Idukki district collector H Dineshan alleging that authorities of Kanayankavayal St Mary’s Church were trying to encroach upon the revenue land. They also erected a trident (trishul) atop the hill to protest the move. Following this, the collector had directed the church authorities to remove the wooden crosses. Peruvanthanam village officer R Wilson said, “Three wooden crosses were installed by the church authorities on last Good Friday. The church would erect crosses before Good Friday and would remove them. But this year, the church authorities failed to remove the crosses.”  The trident was also removed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Club members express shock.description: KOCHI: Members of the Lotus Club are in a state of shock as the district collector has issued an order to recover the land occupied by the club. The historically-important club came into beingdue the effort of Sir Robert Bristow, the architect of willingdon island. It was in 1931, the Lotus Club was established and the members still maintain discipline and culture inculcated by the founders. “Till then, Cochin Club was the club for elite in the area. When Bristow’s wife approached the club authorities for membership, they turned down her request. After this, Bristow visited the king of Kochi and requested for allotting land for constructing a new club. The king granted his plea and Lotus Club was set up in the land thus given by the ruler of erstwhile Kochi kingdom,” said Suresh Raj, a member of the club.  “Lotus Club has a history and it should be protected. The rules, culture and discipline introduced by the founders are being followed by the members even today,” said Raj said. The club conducts annual billiards and snooker tournaments, besides conducting tennis camps. Library, badminton and other sports facilities are other attractions of the club. “Many renowned personalities, including kings of erstwhile kingdom of Kochi, had associated with the club. They visited the club regularly. Even now, stalwarts from different walks of life frequent the club,” said Manoj Padmanabhan, another member of the club. The club has a membership of around 1,500, including women. “Lotus Club is a family club. An qual number of memberships are given to women as well,” Raj said.
